intro: Cremanthodium indicum, commonly known as the Indian cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of South Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in rocky and well-drained soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like. Cremanthodium indicum is often found in high-altitude meadows and is adapted to the cold, harsh conditions of its native habitat.
